hymn.title: In all thy work, O Lord, Thou didst

layout.singingstanza: In all thy work, O Lord, Thou didst At Cal -- v'ry's cross once come to rest; Yet Thou art work -- ing still to -- day, But in a -- noth -- er form ex -- pressed.

lyrics.stanza: In all thy work, O Lord, Thou didst At Calv'ry's cross once come to rest; Yet Thou art working still today, But in another form expressed.
Since Thou art with the Spirit one His coming means that Thou hast come, And His indwelling is Thine own, Since Thou the Spirit hast become.
He executes within my heart All Thy desires and Thy demands, As for the Father here on earth Thou hast performed all His commands.
Thou art not far away in heav'n, Leaving us here alone, apart; But Thou art still on earth; how grand! Thou livest right within my heart.
